summary: This document is an email chain between attorneys and a judge's chambers regarding the sealed filing of a reply brief in the case US v. Noel (19 Cr. 830). It shows procedural communications about submitting sealed documents and ex parte motions, indicating sensitive legal proceedings.

persons.name: Andrew Patel
persons.context: Attorney submitting sealed motions and reply briefs on behalf of a client in the US v. Noel case. He communicates with the court and prosecutors regarding filing procedures.

persons.name: Donald Yannella
persons.context: Appears as a recipient on legal correspondence related to the US v. Noel case, likely involved as counsel.

persons.name: Analisa Torres
persons.context: Judge presiding over the US v. Noel case (19 Cr. 830) who issues orders allowing sealed filings and replies.

persons.name: Jill Shellow
persons.context: Mentioned as a recipient on a sealed motion submission, indicating involvement as defense counsel in the case.

connections.description: Both are attorneys copied on the same legal correspondence regarding the US v. Noel case, suggesting they are working together or on the same legal team.
Patel submits motions and requests to Judge Torres's chambers, and Torres issues orders in response, establishing a formal court relationship.
Both are attorneys involved in the case; Patel notes a motion is submitted ex parte as to defense counsel, which may include Shellow.

events.title: Judge Torres issues order allowing sealed reply
events.description: Judge Analisa Torres issues an order allowing the submission of a brief reply in the US v. Noel case, with both the government's response and the order to be filed under seal.

events.title: Attorney Patel submits sealed reply brief
events.description: Andrew Patel submits a reply brief with exhibits for the US v. Noel case, requested to be filed under seal.

events.title: Judge Torres issues sealed order on counsel request
events.description: Judge Torres resolves a request related to counsel in the US v. Noel case, with the request and order filed under seal.

events.title: Sealed ex parte motion submitted
events.description: Andrew Patel submits a sealed motion ex parte as to defense counsel in the US v. Noel case, requesting a hearing at the court's earliest convenience.

locations: 80 Broad Street, Suite 1900, New York, NY 10004 (Andrew Patel's law office)
500 Pearl Street, New York, New York 10007 (United States District Court for the Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: The document pertains to the criminal case US v. Noel (19 Cr. 830), indicating ongoing sealed proceedings.
Multiple filings and orders in the case are being handled under seal, suggesting sensitive or confidential matters.
Attorney Andrew Patel submitted an ex parte motion as to defense counsel, indicating a request made without notice to the opposing side.
The email chain shows coordination between the defense attorney, prosecutors, and the judge's chambers regarding sealed document procedures.
The case involves multiple attorneys including Andrew Patel, Donald Yannella, and Jill Shellow, indicating a legal team structure.
